meanings.definition: A short, high-pitched sound made by a bird or small animal.
meanings.sent1: The baby bird let out a cheep when it saw its mother.
meanings.sent2: I heard a cheep coming from the bushes, probably a small bird.
meanings.sent3: The little mouse let out a cheep as it scurried across the floor.
meanings.sent4: The cheep of the squirrel outside my window woke me up this morning.
meanings.sent5: The cheep of the chick was so soft and delicate, like a tiny bell ringing.

meanings.definition: To make a short, high-pitched sound like a bird or small animal.
meanings.sent1: The chicks cheeped loudly for their mother to feed them.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the birds cheeping happily in the trees.
meanings.sent3: The kitten tried to cheep like a bird, but it sounded funny.
meanings.sent4: The alarm clock cheeped, waking me up from my nap.
meanings.sent5: The baby goat cheeped in excitement as it ran around the field.
